statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: ACC/BIG TEN CHALLENGE PRESENTED BY DICK'S SPORTING GOODS

article.headline: Virginia 60, Wisconsin 54

inlines.body:
ACC-Big Ten Challenge

Marquee matchups between North Carolina and Indiana and Ohio State and Duke highlight the 2012 ACC-Big Ten Challenge schedule. ESPN.com Topics has full coverage. Profile »

ACC-Big Ten Challenge

Duke's win tied the 2012 ACC-Big Ten Challenge at six wins for each conference for the first time. The Big Ten had won more games the past three seasons after the ACC won the first 10.

Result Win
Minnesota 77, Florida State 68 B1G
Virginia Tech 95, Iowa 79 ACC
Michigan 79, NC State 72 B1G
Maryland 77, Northwestern 57 ACC
Nebraska 79, Wake Forest 63 B1G
Indiana 83, North Carolina 59 B1G
Virginia 60, Wisconsin 54 ACC
Purdue 73, Clemson 61 B1G
Miami 67, Michigan State 59 ACC
Illinois 75, Georgia Tech 62 B1G
Boston College 73, Penn St. 61 ACC
Duke 73, Ohio State 68 ACC

article.story: MADISON, Wis. -- Joe Harris scored 22 points to lead Virginia in a 60-54 win over Wisconsin in the Big Ten-ACC Challenge on Wednesday night. Darion Atkins scored 14 for the Cavaliers (5-2), while Akil Mitchell added 11. Ben Brust led Wisconsin (4-3) with 15 points, while Jared Berggren added 12. Harris was intentionally fouled with just less than a minute left and converted both free throws to put the Cavaliers up 57-50. Berggren then slammed home a miss, and Virginia committed a turnover as the Badgers went to a full-court press. Berggren hit a pair of free throws to pull Wisconsin within 57-54 with 34.4 seconds left, and the Badgers fouled Mitchell in the full-court press. He converted the first, but missed the second. Wisconsin struggled to get a shot off with Brust finally creating contact on a 3-point attempt with 5 seconds left. Mitchell converted two free throws.
